channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Donated Organs
item.description: We explain why some organs are skipping patients who need them.

item.title: Why Scam Centers in Southeast Asia Keep Flourishing
item.description: A China-led crackdown on online fraud rescued thousands from Myanmar this month. But this massive business of grift keeps growing.

item.title: Austrian Parties Reach Deal to Form Government Without Far Right
item.description: The announcement was a victory for mainstream political parties, after earlier talks involving the hard-right Freedom Party broke down.

item.title: Gene Hackman: 5 Memorable Performances to Stream
item.description: He played a complicated hero in “The French Connection” and an arch-villain in “Superman.” Here are some of Hackman’s career highlights.

item.title: Andrew Tate and His Brother Leave Romania for Florida
item.description: Andrew and Tristan Tate were set to arrive in Florida on Thursday, their lawyer said. They are facing investigations in Romania and Britain, including...

item.title: Gene Hackman, Hollywood’s Consummate Everyman, Dies at 95
item.description: The winner of two Oscars, he was hailed for his nuanced performances in films like “The French Connection,” “Unforgiven” and “The Royal Tenenbaums.”

item.title: Westlake looks to housing market for rebound
item.description: As the U.S. housing market continues to defy economic uncertainty, Westlake Corporation is benefiting from strong demand for building materials, even ...

item.description: Andrew and Tristan Tate were set to arrive in Florida on Thursday, their lawyer said. They are facing investigations in Romania and Britain, including...

item.title: WPP stock slumps 15% as ad spending takes a back seat, pushing 2024 revenues down
item.description: WPP's CEO Mark Read noted that the revenue slip was partly due to “weaker client discretionary spend.”

item.title: Trump administration blames ‘institutional drift’ as it plans to cut over 90% of USAID foreign aid contracts
item.description: The funding freeze has stopped thousands of U.S.-funded programs abroad.

item.title: Trump switches his top target from China to the EU—he says after years of being ‘screwed’ by Europe, it will face 25% tariffs
item.description: President Trump was positive on relations with China, while he told his cabinet the EU had been formed to "screw" the United States.

item.title: Romania Opens Criminal Case Against Ultranationalist Politician
item.description: Prosecutors said Calin Georgescu, whose win in the first round of a presidential election was annulled, is the subject of “criminal proceedings” linke...

item.title: U.S. Economy Under Stress, and a Behind-the-Scenes Look at DOGE
Crypto and fintech are enjoying a Trump bump, but how long will it last?
item.description: From memecoins to IPOs: Reflections from a dinner with top fintech and crypto firms.

item.description: A China-led crackdown on online fraud rescued thousands from Myanmar this month. But this massive business of grift keeps growing.
